discussion.content:
C. Sharing Rules
Sharing Rules allow for the configuration of record-level access to ensure that specific groups of users have the visibility they need to records based on criteria or ownership. In this case, you can create a sharing rule to grant access to all records of the JobApplication__c object to users with hiring manager functions, thereby ensuring they can see the salary fields.

D. Permission Sets: Permission Sets are used to grant additional permissions to users, such as access to certain fields or objects. However, they do not handle the visibility of specific records based on criteria or ownership. They are more about extending user permissions rather than managing record sharing.

Therefore, Sharing Rules are the appropriate tool for granting the necessary access to all job applicants’ salary information for users performing hiring manager functions.

Street__c & BR() &: Concatenates the Street__c field with a line break (using BR()) to move to the next line.
City__c & ", " &: Adds the City__c field followed by a comma and space.
Planet__c & " " &: Adds the Planet__c field followed by a space.
